main event: A sighting of two glowing, deep red objects in Hollywood, California on September 6th, 1951. The objects were observed near the moon and displayed characteristics not consistent with known aircraft or astronomical phenomena.
interesting points: The objects appeared deep red and circular, with one emitting a flash of brilliant white light, and displayed incredible acceleration and velocity.
The witness emphasized that the observed movement and technology were far beyond the capabilities of rockets or known aircraft in 1951.
The witness noted the objects' controlled and deliberate movement, their ability to hover and remain perfectly still, as well as their sudden and rapid disappearance.

The witness provided a detailed analysis of the objects' potential origins, ruling out planets within our solar system and theorizing about their potential origin from Saturn, Neptune, or the planet beyond Neptune, later named Pluto.

The witness speculated on the purpose of the observed visit, suggesting that the space voyagers may have been observing the moon and that their technology and equipment exceeded anything known on Earth at the time.
sighted object: two glowing, deep red objects near the moon
